byline.contributor: Ashley Parker reported from Colorado Springs, and Nick Corasaniti from Florida.
byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and NICK CORASANITI

abstract: Interviews with supporters of Donald Trump at campaign events in six states reveal many fear what will happen should he lose to Hillary Clinton, with some suggesting outcome could spark violent conflict; many claim polls showing Clinton ahead are not accurate and many say they do not believe Trump will lose.
lead_paragraph: Among Mr. Trump’s supporters, some worry that they will be forgotten, along with their concerns, if Mrs. Clinton wins. Others predict violent conflict.
snippet: Among Mr. Trump’s supporters, some worry that they will be forgotten, along with their concerns, if Mrs. Clinton wins. Others predict violent conflict....

headline.main: Some Donald Trump Voters Warn of Revolution if Hillary Clinton Wins
headline.print_headline: Trump Backers See Revolution if Clinton Wins
